etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Orosius' History. In Old English from classical Latin philosophus;

definitions: Generally. A philosopher, a thinker; a man of letters, an intellectual.

notes.text: In later use chiefly in French contexts.

definitions: Specifically (usually in form philosophe): a writer or thinker sympathetic to, associated with, or sharing the rationalist philosophies and values of the French Enlightenment (in early use frequently derogatory). Also attributive or as adjective Now historical.
